intro: Argeta petrensis, commonly known as the Transylvanian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian region of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. Argeta petrensis is a perennial herb that produces small, tubular flowers clustered in racemes. Its botanical features make it a notable species in alpine and subalpine ecosystems.
